excavatorBucketCapacity.title: Excavator Bucket Capacity
excavatorBucketCapacity.description: The amount of dirt the excavator bucket can hold in one scoop, measured in cubic yards.
excavatorBucketCapacity.tips: Larger buckets move more dirt per cycle but take longer to fill and dump. Choose based on your excavator size.

excavatorCycleTime.title: Excavator Cycle Time
excavatorCycleTime.description: The time it takes for one complete excavator cycle: dig, swing, dump, and return to digging position.
examples: Ideal conditions with skilled operator: 0.5-1.5 minutes
Difficult conditions or tight spaces: 5-10 minutes
excavatorCycleTime.tips: Factor in soil type, operator skill, and working space. Hard-packed soil and tight areas increase cycle time.

truckCapacity.title: Truck Capacity
truckCapacity.description: The amount of dirt the truck can carry in one load, measured in cubic yards.
truckCapacity.tips: Match truck size to excavator bucket size. Typically, a truck should hold 4-6 excavator buckets for efficiency.

truckRoundTripTime.title: Truck Round-Trip Time
truckRoundTripTime.description: Total time for truck to travel from job site to dump location and back, including loading and dumping time.
truckRoundTripTime.tips: Include time for loading, travel both ways, dumping, and any wait times at the dump site.

pondLength.title: Pond Length
pondLength.description: The longest measurement of your pond from one end to the other, measured in feet.
pondLength.tips: Measure at the waterline level, not the bottom. Use a long tape measure or pacing for large ponds.

pondWidth.title: Pond Width
pondWidth.description: The measurement across your pond at its widest point, measured in feet.
pondWidth.tips: For irregular shapes, use the widest point. Consider access routes for equipment when planning width.

pondDepth.title: Pond Depth
pondDepth.description: How deep you want to dig the pond, measured in feet from ground level to the bottom.
pondDepth.tips: Deeper ponds hold more water but require more excavation. Consider local frost line and intended use.

workHours.title: Work Hours Per Day
workHours.description: Number of productive hours equipment will operate each day on the job site.
workHours.tips: Consider setup time, breaks, fuel stops, and weather delays. Actual productive hours are often less than total hours on site.
